decline_text: r_c decides not to pursue such a dangerous creature, especially seeing as it isn't close to camp.

s_c sets up an ambush for the wandering lizard, sticking it with a spear and leading it on a wild chasing dance across the border and out of c_n territory.

intro_text: Your patrol tracks the scent of a large lizard, wandering along the edge of the Troop's territory.
decline_text: Your patrol decides not to pursue such a dangerous creature, especially seeing as it isn't close to the camp.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol shadows the lizard, sending a message back to warn camp. It's an exhausting and stressful day, but by the time night falls they've confirmed that the lizard is leaving the local area, and the patrol has assured c_n's safety.
Your patrol gathers their courage and valiantly tries to lead away the lizard. With such a small group of scavengers, they can only lead it a short distance, but it's better than nothing.
s_c sets up a careful ambush ahead of the lizard, and the surprising, darting attack bloodies the beast's flank, dissuading it from heading further into c_n territory.

s_c selflessly takes the lion's share of the run as the patrol leads the lizard on, exhausting {PRONOUN/s_c/self} almost to the point of danger, but leading the lizard far away from c_n borders. {PRONOUN/s_c/poss/CAP} Troopmates support {PRONOUN/s_c/object} on the long walk home once it's all over, their hands assuaging s_c's exhausted pants.

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol tries to keep watch on the lizard from a distance, but it spots the scavengers and they have to scatter. Everyone escapes just fine, but they lose track of the lizard. It could be anywhere still out there, lurking, waiting to attack.

s_c tries to take the lion's share of the effort to lead the lizard away, but {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} strength fails {PRONOUN/s_c/object} and the rest of the patrol needs to rescue {PRONOUN/s_c/object}, cutting short the results of the patrol. Instead, everyone knows the lizard could still be lurking on their borders.

The patrol tries to lead the lizard away from the Troop's borders, but with so few scavengers it's impossible to cover each other's backs. r_c falls to the lizard as the rest of the patrol runs for their lives back to camp, terrified out of their pelts and mourning their Troopmate.

intro_text: Your patrol stumbles across a caramel lizard, wandering in the middle of the Troop's territory.
decline_text: Your patrol decides not to pursue such a dangerous creature. c_n will just have to hope it doesn't come any nearer to camp.

success_outcomes.text: They decide that no scavenger is going to be surprised by this predator again, and the patrol shadows the lizard, sending a message to warn camp. With enough scavengers to keep watch, rest, track, and send messages forward and back from camp, c_n is kept safe from the wandering lizard.

Your patrol gathers their courage and valiantly drives away the lizard. Together, working as one, and with all the strength of StarClan behind them, the patrol presses the lizard. By keeping up a series of small skirmishes through the entire day, they drive it all the way off c_n territory.

s_c has just enough time to yell out a plan, leading the whole large patrol in a skillful battle plan against the lizard that protects the scavengers from the chance of injury. The lizard tucks tail, and runs for more friendly lands.

s_c selflessly throws {PRONOUN/s_c/self} into the fight, and every time the lizard tries to grab at {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} Troopmates, {PRONOUN/s_c/subject}{VERB/s_c/'re/'s} there with claws, fur puffed out to twice {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} normal size. With s_c defending them, the patrol drives the lizard off, yowling triumphantly.

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol tries to keep watch on the lizard from a distance, but it spots the scavengers and they have to scatter. It's not as bad as it could've been though; r_c manages to keep track of the lizard's position, and it doesn't come any further into c_n territory.

s_c tries to protect {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} Troopmates, but it gets in the way of the attack. Without everyone committed to driving the lizard off, the patrol has to fall back, but they do so in good order.

With so many scavengers all working as one, the lizard started to get beaten back. But just as the tide of the fight seems about to turn, one lucky strike hits r_c, and those vicious jaws take {PRONOUN/r_c/object} to StarClan.

The animal is far more tenacious than r_c ever expected, and once the fight starts, there's no escaping from it. intro_text: Your patrol comes across a small lizard, right on the border of c_n territory.
decline_text: p_l decides not to pursue the lizard, instead cutting the patrol short to head back to camp and report it.

success_outcomes.text: p_l raises {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} spear at the small lizard, and the rest of their small team back them up. The lizard skitters back, fizzing loudly, apparently shocked by the display. The patrol hurl rocks and rubble until the small beast's nerve breaks, and it runs from the c_n border into the distance.

The patrol paces towards the small lizard, spears raised, backed up with the courage of their Troopmates. The lizard burbles and snaps its jaws, but that's their opportunity to attack, covering each other as they push the creature away from their lands.

s_c calls out a battle plan, and the scavengers flow into it, carefully covering each other and driving the lizard backwards until its nerve breaks, it tucks tail, and it runs from c_n territory headed deep into the wilderness.

intro_text: The patrol notice in the distance a scavenger who's clearly from the city, pacing back and forth and looking around anxiously.
decline_text: p_l decides it's none of {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} business, and resumes {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} patrol.

success_outcomes.text: When the patrol approaches p_l comforts the cowering stranger and asks what's wrong. The stranger has been waiting for hours for their friends to come back, though a short conversation is enough for p_l to realise that they never had any intention of returning. It takes some convincing, but the stranger finally accepts the offer of a place in the Troop, and looks sadly back at the distant metropolis as they follow the patrol home.

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol draws near just in time to see a vulture swoop down, seize the scavenger with a sickening crunch, and carry their body away into the sky. Once the gas clears, there's no sign they were ever there.

antag_fail_outcomes.text: As the patrol draws near with spears raised, the stranger jumps and scurries away, back towards the distant metropolis. {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP} {VERB/p_l/decide/decides} to resume the border patrol - it's not {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} problem anymore.

p_l orders the patrol except r_c back to camp. p_l and r_c grab the cubs despite their protests. On their journey to o_c_n they are greeted by a concerned patrol that is very happy and grateful to see the cubs safe, thanking them profusely.

p_l orders the patrol to go back to camp, asking that r_c be left behind to help {PRONOUN/p_l/object}. The pair convince the cubs that they are about to get the best badger ride ever. As they approach o_c_n's camp with the cubs squealing with joy on their backs, they are greeted with relief and laughter.

p_l decides to bring r_c with {PRONOUN/p_l/object} to o_c_n and orders the others back to camp. As they approach o_c_n, they are immediately greeted by the leader, who recognizes p_l - knowing {PRONOUN/p_l/object} to be a kind and caring cat - and thanks both of them sincerely.

fail_outcomes.text: As p_l goes to step over the border with r_c to retrieve the cubs and bring them to their Troop, they hear a o_c_n patrol shouting for the cubs and stop. p_l is relieved to know they will be safe with their own Troop and resume {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} patrol. The patrol doesn't realize that the o_c_n cats saw them cross the border and now look upon their departing backs with fury.

As p_l crosses the border with r_c to grab the cubs, a o_c_n patrol suddenly appears with their spears raised! Setting the cub back down, r_c attempts to explain the situation only to be impaled against a wall by the force of a hurled spear. p_l races back over to their side of the border, just barely escaping the wrath of o_c_n warriors.

intro_text: While passing through a pipe between territories, the patrol chance across a hollow where a mound of eggs is visible past the crimson coils of a massive centipede. This monster must be hunting on o_c_n territory.
decline_text: It's not c_n's problem, but {PRONOUN/p_l/subject}  {VERB/p_l/make/makes} a mental note to mention the centipede to {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} leader later.

success_outcomes.text: p_l is not willing to let any cat die to a red centipede. {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP} {VERB/p_l/order/orders} the patrol to continue on while {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/wait/waits} on an o_c_n patrol to come by, so p_l can warn them about the centipede.

The o_c_n patrol is grateful and return to camp immediately to report the centipede to their leader.

p_l tells the patrol to continue on and hops over the border to walk to o_c_n's camp. {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP} {VERB/p_l/are/is} greeted at the camp entrance with bristled fur, glaring eyes and the leader demanding to know what {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/are/is} doing there. {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP} {VERB/p_l/explain/explains} the situation and with {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} smooth talking skills manage to convince the cats of {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} good intentions. intro_text: p_l is showing several apprentices the border, and points out some good spots to keep watch on specific parts of it.
decline_text: p_l has no patience for the rowdy apprentices that day, and orders them all back to camp.

success_outcomes.text: p_l is very proud of the apprentices. They are all attentive and are asking some great questions about c_n and their relations to the other Troops.

p_l is laughing at the faces the apprentices are making, as they complain about all the icky smells coming from the other Troops at the border. They keep up their disgusted grimaces while asking questions about the other Troops and their specific cultures.

fail_outcomes.text: p_l just can't deal with those ridiculous apprentices today. {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP}{VERB/p_l/'ve/'s} had to stop app1 from crossing the border twice now. {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP} {VERB/p_l/order/orders} them all back to camp, scolding them along the way.

intro_text: p_l slinks through c_n's territory, low to the ground and watchful as {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/approach/approaches} the o_c_n border. The moon hangs heavy in the sky, and {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} eyes dart around, taking in {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} surroundings - did {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} make it here unnoticed?

Perking up, p_l rushes forward, wrapping {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} arms around a scavenger from o_c_n. Fingers entwined, they talk in hushed voices until the stars start to blink out. With a soft goodbye, each returns home, their Troops unknowing of their secret.

p_l strolls across as if {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/belong/belongs} there. At the end of a hidden path sits a scavenger from o_c_n, who rises to take p_l's hands in theirs. The two simply sit together, the light of the moon dappling their pelts as they enjoy each other's company. When dawn approaches, r_c heads home, {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} absence and return each unnoticed.

p_l noses forward, half hidden, only stepping out when n_c0's scent hits {PRONOUN/p_l/object}. They've been planning this for moons - tonight is the night. n_c0 is ready to join c_n, to join p_l, and damn anyone who gossips to the dark forest. Tonight is the first night of the rest of their lives together. Nothing is going to stop them.

p_l just about walks right into o_c_n's camp, {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} steps so practiced and quiet {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} may as well not be there at all. A cat from o_c_n ducks out and twines their tails together, pressing their side to p_l's with a purr. They slowly walk to the border, murmuring to each other about this and that, where they part ways with a gentle brush of their noses.

fail_outcomes.text: There's movement across the border, and while p_l's heart beats fast at the sight of a certain scavenger, {PRONOUN/p_l/subject}'{VERB/p_l/re/s} crestfallen to see them accompanied by a Troopmate. The Troopmate stares with narrowed eyes at p_l, gruffly reminding {PRONOUN/p_l/object} to stay on {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} own side of the border before whisking away with the other scavenger in tow.

Boldly, p_l steps right across the border, only to be unceremoniously yanked back by the spines almost right away. {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP} {VERB/p_l/look/looks} over {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} shoulder in bewilderment, heart sinking when {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/see/sees} one of {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} Troopmates staring {PRONOUN/p_l/object} down. {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP} would almost rather be seeing a vulture right now... how will {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} explain this?

There's movement across the border, and while p_l's heart beats fast at the sight of a certain scavenger, {PRONOUN/p_l/subject}'{VERB/p_l/re/s} crestfallen to see them accompanied by a Troopmate. What's worse, this scavenger is one known to be aggressive, and tonight is no different - p_l is sent back to camp with {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} tail between {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} legs, a fresh wound glistening in the moonlight.

fail_outcomes.text: Deciding it looks safe enough, p_l walks across the border... right into a late-night border patrol. {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP}'{VERB/p_l/re/s} dealt with pretty quickly, and {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} fur prickles with embarrassment as {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/scramble/scrambles} back over the border, trying to figure out how {PRONOUN/p_l/subject}'ll explain the fresh wounds scoring {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} pelt to {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} Troopmates.

Of all the nights for there to be a night patrol {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} didn't know about, it had to be tonight? {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP} {VERB/p_l/get/gets} such an earful that a certain scavenger from o_c_n hears and wanders over, watching the altercation with an unreadable expression. antag_success_outcomes.text: p_l strolls across the border, deliberately laying {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} scent everywhere {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} can. For good measure, {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/hunt/hunts} and {VERB/p_l/kill/kills} a squidcada, feasting messily and leaving the wings and chunks of shell strewn about. That'll show those good-for-nothing o_c_n scavengers who really owns these lands.

intro_text: On border patrol, the patrol finds kittypet scent. Following the (extremely) obvious sounds of distress, p_l leads the patrol down to a kittypet, who has haplessly managed to get themself wedged between a couple rocks. Wailing pathetically, they cry that their wing is stuck!
decline_text: It's beyond c_n's border, it's not c_n's problem.

success_outcomes.text: Cats don't normally come with wings, much less bat ones, and the patrol flinches back from the foreign stranger. But unnatural or not, the stranger's still stuck, and with a deep breath, p_l orders them forward to free a fellow cat... ish... thing.

Frankly, extra limbs or not (bat wings, at that, this'll make a great story back at camp), the patrol needs to get this plump crying ball of fur back to their Twolegs - the world will eat this kittypet alive if they don't help them.

fail_outcomes.text: Falling over, paws waving helplessly in the air and somehow making the situation even worse, the patrol passes the idiotic kittypet by, leaving them to their stupidity while they focus on their actual task.

antag_fail_outcomes.text: Swaggering up, p_l tries to intimidate the kittypet. But while the cat is easily successfully frightened, that doesn't make them any less stuck in place, and eventually the patrol is forced to help set them free, if only so they can leave c_n's borders.

antag_success_outcomes.text: Hissing, p_l bowls the kittypet over, and with a ripping sound, the bat wing detaches from their back. The plump cat's crying increases in volume as they flee. p_l brings the trophy back to camp to boast.

intro_text: The patrol heads out to check the borders when p_l says {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/see/sees} strange glowing eyes in the distance.
decline_text: r_c sighs and tells p_l that {PRONOUN/p_l/subject}{VERB/p_l/'re/'s} just seeing things, there's nothing out there... right?

success_outcomes.text: The patrol cautiously heads in the direction of the strange, unmoving eyes. The cats see a strange face with glowing eyes in the distance, baring its fangs and smelling of smoke. p_l creeps up to the face to find it that it belongs to a pumpkin! Startled and somewhat scared, r_c suggests heading back to camp to report this bizarre finding to the Troop. p_l agrees, not wanting to be near this... thing... any longer.

The patrol cautiously heads in the direction of the strange, unmoving eyes. When p_l gets closer {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/are/is} overwhelmed with the scent of Twolegs and smoke. Upon closer inspection it seems that these foolish Twoleg cubs are trying to set fire to a pumpkin with an unsettling hollow face! p_l and r_c charge the Twoleg cubs, hissing, spitting, and doing their best to scare them off. Thankfully the cubs scatter before they set the pumpkin ablaze.

As the patrol heads in the direction of the sinister glare of strange, unmoving eyes, the scent of smoke creeps up on the patrol. s_c darts forward, finding the smoke scent coming from an odd pumpkin with some sort of... face? Thinking quickly {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/scratch/scratches} dirt into the holes on the pumpkin, extinguishing the small flames, but leaving the patrol wondering what in the name of StarClan they're looking at.

The patrol nervously heads towards the unblinking eyes, unsure of what lies ahead. As the strange object comes into view, s_c lets out a mrrow of laughter! {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/explain/explains} that this is a Twoleg ritual performed around the start of leaf-bare. p_l is glad to have a cat with s_c's understanding of Twolegs on this patrol. With this knowledge, unneeded panic was surely avoided!

The patrol nervously heads towards the unblinking eyes, unsure of what lies ahead. As the strange object comes into view, s_c begins to bristle with unease. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} can see strange, mist-like Twolegs floating around the glowing, unblinking face of a... pumpkin? The figures approach s_c, and run their cold, fur-less paws through {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} fur. s_c can hardly hear r_c asking {PRONOUN/s_c/object} why {PRONOUN/s_c/subject}{VERB/s_c/'re/'s} frozen in place.

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol cautiously heads in the direction of the strange, unmoving eyes. As they get closer to what seems to be some sort of pumpkin, a group of Twoleg cubs springs out of nowhere and chases the frightened cats off! The patrol runs until the Twolegs stop following. Panting and defeated, they return to camp with not much information about the strange face.

As r_c slowly creeps towards the disturbing face, s_c huffs with frustration. Tail lashing, s_c calls r_c a mouse-heart and stomps in the direction of the unblinking eyes without a shred of fear. s_c rolls {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} eyes and knocks over the harmless pumpkin, ignoring the strange face and the smell of smoke wafting around it.

As r_c slowly creeps towards the disturbing face, s_c recklessly darts forward to get a closer look! {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/crash/crashes} into some strange pumpkin, knocking it over and obscuring the strange face. The patrol heads home without much left to investigate thanks to s_c's antics.

intro_text: The patrol stumbles upon a strange scene near a Twolegplace: Twoleg cubs traveling from den to den in colorful pelts.
decline_text: The patrol decides it's best not to interfere with this peculiar ritual.

success_outcomes.text: r_c, being ever so curious, decides to see if {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} can decipher the meaning behind this Twoleg ritual. After some time, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/realize/realizes} it's some kind of friendly exchange. Each time the Twoleg cubs go to the den, they receive a bit of prey from the older Twolegs. The patrol takes note and continues on their way, amused by the strange Twoleg customs.

r_c cautiously approaches the Twoleg cubs, intrigued by their colorful pelts. To r_c's surprise, one of the tiny Twolegs offers {PRONOUN/r_c/object} a strange, shiny object. It doesn't smell exactly like prey, but r_c decides to take it back to the camp for further investigation.

r_c decides to mimic the small Twolegs. Approaching a larger Twoleg den, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/meow/meows} softly at the entrance. The Twoleg that opens the entrance seems amused and hands r_c a morsel of food. The patrol decides to inspect it further once they return to camp.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c, being ever so curious, decides to see if {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} can decipher the meaning behind this Twoleg ritual. However, after some time, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/give/gives} up, concluding that it's just another strange Twoleg custom that Troop cats will never understand.

The patrol attempts to get closer to the Twoleg cubs, but their presence causes panic among the little creatures. The larger Twolegs nearby seem agitated, waving their paws and stomping around. The cats quickly retreat to avoid causing further disruption.

intro_text: On the outskirts of the territory, the patrol comes across a tall, motionless Twoleg rooted in the middle of a field.
decline_text: The patrol doesn't want to risk going near this strange Twoleg and quickly heads back to camp to report the odd sighting.

success_outcomes.text: r_c hesitantly approaches the Twoleg, fur bristling and on guard. It doesn't appear to notice {PRONOUN/r_c/object} yet. Paw by paw, r_c inches forward, but realizes something seems off. Is this Twoleg... even alive? With some more investigation, r_c finds hay sticking out of the Twoleg's pelt. How odd. r_c reports back with {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} findings.
s_c sneaks up behind the Twoleg. With a mighty roar, s_c leaps onto its back and {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} momentum sends the Twoleg falling to the ground with a giant thump.

s_c stops the patrol, narrowing {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} eyes. That isn't a Twoleg! {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} came across one before during {PRONOUN/s_c/object} time outside the Troop. It's a 'scarecrow', {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/explain/explains}, meant to protect the Twoleg fields from harm. The patrol continues on their way, giving the scarecrow a wide berth.

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol decides to take no chances and sets up an ambush around the Twoleg. They wait... and wait... but the Twoleg makes no movements to attack. Finally, r_c notices that the Twoleg isn't even a Twoleg at all! They wasted all of that time for nothing.

s_c sneaks up behind the Twoleg. With a mighty roar, s_c leaps onto its back and {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} momentum sends both of them to the ground. s_c ends up covered in hay, {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} claws sunk into a harmless scarecrow.
